column5: Board Does anyone have any recent information on whether the ice is off on the north Arm of Rainy Lake? Thanks Brad

Here's the satellite shot from Monday. Today and yesterday were too cloudy to see anything. Looks like it has a chance by the weekend. You can check it yourself here:https://worldview.earthdata.nasa.gov/
I flew over rainy today. The north arm is ice free except for some large sheets left in the main body just north of the causeway. Should be gone in a couple days
